content.question: Consider the curve given by the parametric equations x = 2t3 − 3t2 and y = t3 − 12t (a) In terms of t, find dy / dx.

frqParts.text: Consider the curve given by the parametric equations x = 2t3 − 3t2 and y = t3 − 12t (a) In terms of t, find dy / dx.
(b) Write an equation for the line tangent to the curve at the point where t = −1.
(c) Find the x- and y-coordinates for each critical point on the curve and identify each point as having a vertical or horizontal tangent.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
